intro: Lloydia delicatula, commonly known as the delicate lloydia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive appearance. Lloydia delicatula is also valued for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh conditions.
